comments.commentBody:
While doing temp work, I served as receptionist at one the schools named in the article. My phone list consisted of little more than one president, one dean, and 14 recruiters.

I saw many families of foreign origin come in, parents not fluent in English, and many inexperienced young people on their own who had no one to tell them they were being scammed by smirking, low-rent recruiters.

A school that doesn’t exist for the sole purpose of serving its students should not be eligible to receive government funds. Those funds are rightfully intended to help create bright futures for young people. If we know our children and young adults are being scammed, it is wrong to turn our backs on them and abandon them, in their innocence, to unscrupulous people trying to make a buck.

Billions are going down the drain in these scams, and at the same time we are throwing away the hopes of our young people and burying them in debt.

Holy smoke, government, what else do you need to know before you get up and protect our kids?

When the population growth was high, capitalism was the logical path.

Now that the population growth is slowing, with baby boomers getting old, socialism will be the logical outcome.
A debtor nation.  Why save when you get zilch?  Spend it now before it is worthless ... or keep it under the mattress and away from those greedy banks.

Now that the top 0.01% of the US population has everything it wants in terms of wealth and power, it's time to exterminate the lower 99.99% of the US population and get rid of all this whining and complaining.  You people deserve what's coming to you.

Where is innovation in our economy. With cheap money and huge profits corporations have seen, where are the manufacturing jobs that used to be the backbone of our middle class? Borrowing money from a bank should be easier if there is only profit to be made for the banks, yet banks have tightened thier lending criteria. And all the while China is booming while the rest of the world stagnates, whats wrong with this picture?
Perhaps we Americans should refuse to buy anything from China, so that we can regain our jobs and bring prosperity back to our shores for all of us. After all, not all of us are IT professionals, bankers, white collar traders or corporate management, they seem to be the only ones making money and getting bonuses on top of that. Most of us are blue collar workers that worked in manufacturing which stimulated the service sector. The service sector can't carry us without the manufacturing jobs. These manufacturing jobs have been stolen from us by our own inattention to what some politicians and corperate lobbists have parleyed into getting things cheaply made in China, shipped into our country (just as cheaply) and then sold for MSRP (manufactured suggested retail price). The junk we get from China should be sold for far far less then a quality union made American product is sold for because China doesn't care about us, the enviroment or playing fairly on the world market. Yet American corperations, with the help of some of our politicians, continue to invest in thier economy instead of ours. If thats the case these corperations and thier owners should be paying much more taxes on thier profits so we can retool and retrain our America so we can compete in the inovative future.
China is leading America in almost every field now and if we don't do something soon the very banks that are getting the cheap money for lending will not have anyone here to borrow to, unless they work for the very corperations that deal with the chineese, while they rob

This low interest rates only help the bankers and the investment firm at the expense of the majority of us, the American people. If you have money in the bank, they pay 0.25% but if you need money for the college then you pay 7% or more, if you have credit card debt you may pay 20 or more per cent. The interest rates are low for what they pay but not for what they charge. We are being robe both ways with the blessings and complicity of the federal reserve. What we need is "Jobs" and keeping the interest rates below the inflation had no help us, they are helping the high ranks of the financial institutions bot not the majority of us the American people.
Didn't work in Japan after twenty years...need a different approach....

The Republican party in 2011 is an embarrassment to the USA.  Perhaps their roots go back to the over-the-top Puritans that settled our country, but the Puritans were good people.  Somehow, over-the-top religious people have bred with each other over the last 200 years to create a political party that has nothing to do with the founders of our country.  Our founders were able to put religion and financial interests aside for the love of America.  Look back to the values of our founders!  I see only selfishness in many of these posts.

[[17. Paul White Plains, NY August 9th, 2011 9:15 am 31 months into his administration, President Obama has decided maybe its finally time to think about jobs.]]

Oh, STOP IT, you silly child. The President has made jobs and the economy a priority from the beginning of his administration. Please take your whining, simplistic message to a Yahoo comment board or some other high-minded venue.

[[4. jcarys Minneapolis August 9th, 2011 8:10 am OK, so $8 trillion dollars disappeared from valuations in the last two weeks. This is exactly what was predicted, while all those famous economists at the Tea Party told us all our fears were overblown. Exactly where do we send the invoice to TP HQ, and when can I expect my check? Will American voters actually learn something from this sad drama?]]

Here's what you should have learned by now. Buy on the dip.

Got it?
Thanks, Obama!

Obama's next speach should ring like Kennedy's moon speach...
He will ask us to try harder... Not work harder, of course, as there are no jobs...
Those High Frequency Trading computers must be working overtime to keep up with Murdock's shredders...

This situation originated in a manufactured partisan fight of epic proportions.
These GOP tea-partiers are not showing concern for the financial well-being of our nation, no matter WHAT they are saying.
Watching the events in Wisconsin tonight, it is clear the national election in 2012 is going to be a monumental effort of corporate money against citizen expression as we haven't seen in our history since the nation was founded.
The numbers are astounding and the flow of money will be ground-breaking and scandalous.
Americans simply HAVE to start paying attention to the issues, civics and the history of this country.

Will it make them think that perhaps people are the reason for government and not saving money bu sacrificing people?  Since they are modern GOP, I guess we know the answer. Just saying, "Whew!" and feeling vindicated they'll keep on the same destructive road.
Too bad. How about we all agree that this was NOT a litmus test for 2012 after all? :)
With millions of out of state dollars spent, republican retention does not bode well for Mr Obama.

It would amuse me if the Dems gained two seats in this recall election, but then lost two in the next one.  At that point, millions and millions of dollars would have been spent to have the makeup of the Wisconsin State Senate remain the same.
Too bad for Wisconsin - I'm sure if the republicans won, fraud was involved.

If Wisconsin is a microcosm of what's to come for the whole nation next year, this is mixed news. I am still flabbergasted at how traditionally progressive Wisconsin so completely turned into just another red state. The power of the Republicans has been whittled down, but it was a long hard slog. Hopefully they will at least be chastized. I also hope that Senator Wirtch in my district keeps his seat next Tuesday.

If the Republicans remain in power here, our state motto should be changed from "Forward" to "Backward."

The fact that this is news is pathetic!  This is what should have been happening all along. It angers me that it took authorities this long to actually start enforcing the law.  They have been too lax for decades.

Living a few miles from the border, I see this daily. All I can say is good riddance.

As for the checks, well, they'll think twice about coming back if they know they're in the system.

Rather do it now than face the same people breaking more of our laws when the economy picks back up.

If money launderers or weapons smugglers want to move contraband south to Mexico why would they use Mexican immigrants, legal or illegal? Use US citizens as they are not going to be searched by NRA-adverse American personnel and less likely to be hassled by Mexican customs officers. This is just theatre to give the current administration a photo op to look tough. It is the south-bound equivalent of drone aircraft and Border Patrol officers getting their photographs taken chasing would-be gardeners while truckloads of drugs cross the border unimpeded.

comments.userLocation: Deep in the Heart of Texas
comments.commentBody:
#1: It doesn't really matter. And, in fact, capital punishment has never been shown to have prevented even one murder.
--------------

Concealed hand gun laws are even more likely to prevent murders. And trials.

Question: Why hadn't Tacoma police already loaded the DNA into the database?  It seems like there's a far higher chance of it hitting someone else in Codis... high enough that they would have done it years ago if they were serious about closing the cold case.
